body:
this is clearly showing an expected warning
you can ask on SO if you want but please read the docs

I also tried:
```
pd.options.mode.chained_assignment = None
```
After pandas had been imported and it seems to work, but sometimes it throws this:
```
Exception in Tkinter callback
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\tkinter\__init__.py", line 1558, in __call__
    return self.func(*args)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\tkinter\__init__.py", line 605, in callit
    func(*args)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_tkagg.py", line 323, in idle_draw
    self.draw()
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_tkagg.py", line 304, in draw
    FigureCanvasAgg.draw(self)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\backends\backend_agg.py", line 430, in draw
    self.figure.draw(self.renderer)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\artist.py", line 55, in draw_wrapper
    return draw(artist, renderer, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\figure.py", line 1299, in draw
    renderer, self, artists, self.suppressComposite)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\image.py", line 138, in _draw_list_compositing_images
    a.draw(renderer)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\artist.py", line 55, in draw_wrapper
    return draw(artist, renderer, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axes\_base.py", line 2437, in draw
    mimage._draw_list_compositing_images(renderer, self, artists)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\image.py", line 138, in _draw_list_compositing_images
    a.draw(renderer)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\artist.py", line 55, in draw_wrapper
    return draw(artist, renderer, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axis.py", line 1133, in draw
    ticks_to_draw = self._update_ticks(renderer)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axis.py", line 974, in _update_ticks
    tick_tups = list(self.iter_ticks())
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\axis.py", line 917, in iter_ticks
    majorLocs = self.major.locator()
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\dates.py", line 1097, in __call__
    self.refresh()
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\dates.py", line 1117, in refresh
    dmin, dmax = self.viewlim_to_dt()
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\dates.py", line 875, in viewlim_to_dt
    return num2date(vmin, self.tz), num2date(vmax, self.tz)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\dates.py", line 466, in num2date
    return _from_ordinalf(x, tz)
  File "C:\Users\amoro\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\matplotlib\dates.py", line 279, in _from_ordinalf
    dt = datetime.datetime.fromordinal(ix).replace(tzinfo=UTC)
ValueError: ordinal must be >= 1
```

Could anyone help please?
